New Records: The Los Angeles Dodgers are two wins away from the World Series title after winning the first two games.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani exited the game due to a shoulder injury during a stolen base attempt in the seventh inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers held a two-game lead in the World Series after their second win.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts expressed concern over Shohei Ohtani's injury and mentioned he was 'expecting him to be there' for the rest of the series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The series will shift to New York for Game 3 after the Dodgers' commanding 2-0 lead.
Others: Yoshinobu Yamamoto pitched effectively, striking out Aaron Judge twice and allowing only one hit in 6â…“ innings.
